title: Meta: Ralph loop fidelity and completion patterns
rationale:
Observed during Phase 4 execution: Ralph loops need configurable quality gates and better completion tracking.

FIDELITY PARAMETER:
The oracle-loop skill should ask fidelity upfront and compose other skills accordingly:
- Quick: oracles after major phases only
- Standard: second-opinion/code-review after each subsection
- Thorough: all quality skills after each item
The skill already knows available skills - should auto-compose based on fidelity choice.

USER INPUT HANDLING:
Pausing defeats autonomous purpose. Better model:
- Loop continues autonomously
- Unresolved items (after second-opinion fails) go to 'needs human' queue
- Queue surfaces at loop end: '3 items need your review'
This preserves autonomy while capturing genuine blockers.

PARTIAL COMPLETION VIA NESTED CHECKBOXES:
Binary checkboxes don't capture 'implemented but needs polish'. Solution:
- [ ] 4.1 AgentPanel component
  - [x] Basic structure
  - [x] Session grouping  
  - [ ] Accessibility audit ‚Üê surfaced as incomplete
Sub-items also get surfaced in end-of-loop summary.

COMMIT GRANULARITY:
'Commit progress' led to 6 micro-commits needing squash. Specify: 'commit after each major item' or 'batch by section'.

Expected output: Updates to oracle-loop skill with fidelity parameter, nested checkbox support, and end-of-loop summary of unresolved/partial items.
